conclusion: Liquid will flow out from points A, B, and C and will end up in containers D, E, or F after passing through baffles.

conclusion: The liquid from point A is diverted to the left.

conclusion: The liquid from point A flows into container D.

conclusion: The liquid from point B is deflected to the left by the purple slanted baffle.

premise: The liquid from point C flows downward and encounters the cyan slanted baffle.
conclusion: The liquid from point C is deflected to the right by the cyan slanted baffle.

conclusion: The liquid from point C flows into container F.

premise: Liquid from point A flows into container D, liquid from point B flows into container E, and liquid from point C flows into container F.
conclusion: Stream A ends in container D; stream B ends in container E; stream C ends in container F.
